greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of partitions of n into exactly k positive Fibonacci numbers; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) is defined for n,k >= 0.  The triangle contains only the terms with k <= n.  T(n,k) = 0 for k > n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..200, flattened
maple: b:= proc(n, i) option remember; `if`(n=0 or i=1, x^n,
T:= n-> (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..n))(b(n, h(n))):
mathematica: T[n_, k_] := SeriesCoefficient[1/Product[(1 - y x^Fibonacci[j]) + O[x]^(n+1) // Normal, {j, 2, n+1}], {x, 0, n}, {y, 0, k}];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 40}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 28 2020 *)
h[n_] := h[n] = If[n < 1, 0, If[Function[t, IntegerQ@Sqrt[t + 4] || IntegerQ@Sqrt[t - 4]][5 n^2], n, h[n - 1]]];
Table[T[n, k], {n, 0, 20}, {k, 0, n}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 07 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 18 2018
